Posts.Content: Jun 7, 2009 10:59AM Tamara1201 wrote: Hi Lemonpie, I'm sorry you are going through this, like it's not rough enough without having trouble doing even the basic things, like walking, due to the hand/food syndrome. My Mother had that problem when she took Xeloda years ago, and basically it's like having a second degree burn and has to be treated as such. If it isn't blistered they told her to put a heavy duty moisturizer on it, like bag balm. I get it at Walmart or Walgreens, it's in a green can. It's thick like vaseline but has some added stuff in it, I use it on my feet to this day, just so I will have soft feet. If it's blistered the skin will peel off, I had to basically debride her skin, cutting off the dead part,and bandaged it with antibiotic ointment. Eventually it all peeled off and revealed baby soft pink skin, which she was very proud of because her feet were, well kind of ugly before. I think one of the big concerns, which goes with everything anymore, is the concern for infection, so keeping it clean is very important. I would think that as long as you don't feel like it's getting infected it could wait until you could talk to your doctor tomorrow, because I'm like you, the ER is the last place I want to be, and unfortunately it's a great place to get exposed to germs. hope it helps a little, good luck Tamara
Posts.Title: Help with chemo side effects lemonpie LinTol

Posts.Content: Jun 7, 2009 09:29AM Tamara1201 wrote: Hi Everyone, I'm new to this, the blogs and the whole exeprience, but I'm a nurse and I know a lot of plastic surgeons and cardiac surgeons wouldn't even consider sugery on someone who smokes, because it decreases the circulation and delays healing. I've never smoked, but if I did, I doubt I would be able to quit right now, my Mother tried off and on for years, without success. As far as the alcohol I think the big thing is that the chemo can be so toxic to your liver, and so can alcohol, so they don't want you doing anything else than can damage your liver. They were supposed to start my chemo last Thursday, and didn't because my liver enzymes are elevated. I rarely drink, not that I didn't do more of it in my younger years, but I'm already on so much medicine that can damage my liver, I just avoid it. I had a CT of my abdomen Friday to see if something is going on in my liver, but with the increased liver enzymes, they have to lower the dose of the chemo, and as much as I'm not looking forward to this experience, I want it to take care of the problem, so hope I can get the full amount  Tamara
Posts.Title: ALCOHOL / SMOKING - during chemo!!! HELP!!! TravisC bwbly

Posts.Content: Jun 10, 2009 03:16PM Tamara1201 wrote: Greytmom_17, I'm glad your treatment today went smoothly. I start tomorrow and my biggest concern right now is the fact that I don't sleep when I have to take steroids, and they knock my pre existing heart arrhythmia into over drive. I have an appt with my cardiologist on Friday, so I'm hoping he can do something about that, because the increased heart rate makes me feel even more fatigued and short of breath, never know which problem is causing what SE.  I saw a post you did last night, and you said you got the biotin  tooth paste and mouth wash, I bought some of that a while back. have really bad trouble with dry mouth from my meds, and I coudln't stand the taste. There is another mouth wash, it's called Oasis, and it's not nearly as bad, but I haven't been able to find any toothpaste by them.  I kind of like the "jug-r-naughts", although I still have "jugs" just more off balance than usual lol
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Jun 23, 2009 08:52AM Tamara1201 wrote: Candy14510, I'm sorry your boss is being such a jerk, some people just don't get it, I tell myself it will come back and bite them on the butt, but not sure that's true. did you fill out FMLA paperwork at work? If you didn't you should talk to the HR dept about it. It helps to protect your rights when you are sick. I hope your hair hangs in there for your son's graduation
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Jun 23, 2009 11:55AM Tamara1201 wrote: Candy14510, I believe it's 12 weeks, which would be 60  work days at 8 hrs a day, but that 12 weeks can be broken up into hours, so if you are working half days it stretches it out longer. Good luck, wish you had a more compassionate boss
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Jun 5, 2009 07:50PM Tamara1201 wrote: Hi Greytmom_17, I live in the panhandle of Florida, between Pensacola and Panama City, and it's been hot and humid for months already so I'm thinking a little breeze on my scalp might feel good for a while. I went to walk the dog earier, and every night by the time I get back my head/hair is soaking with sweat, guess I might need a towel if I don't have the hair to absorb it lol I got the CT of my abdomen this afternoon, after not sleeping again all last night thanks to the steroids. I have to admit the elevated liver enzymes has me a little worried but I'm trying to remain positive, blame it on a fatty liver, Lord knows I have enough "fat" for it to end up there too. I'm planning to go get a copy of the report Monday, I hate waiting for doctors to call me. I hope you all have a nice, nausea free, weekend Tamara
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Jun 9, 2009 02:57PM Tamara1201 wrote: Beach2Read, I start chemo  this Thursday, the 11th as long as everything goes okay. I keep feeling like I'm getting a sore throat, and I'm sure they wouldn't start if if that was the case so I'm trying to chase it away.  Thanks for the name comment, I hated it when I was a kid, mostly because teachers always pronounced it wrong, and drew attention to me, and I hated that, now I like it, just took me a while. PAP  It is so hot and humid here today, and my head sweats so bad, I'm not sure I'll miss my hair a lot. I'm sure once it's gone I will, and I'm so pale I'm sure my scalp will cause a glare, but I think I'm going to mainly go with scarves and hats to, although  I've never been a hat person. Of course, I'm sure everytime I get in and out of the car I'll knock it off my head, but might not be quiet as shocking to bystanders and knocking my "hair" off lol
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Jun 11, 2009 07:06AM Tamara1201 wrote: Well I'm off for my second attempt at my first TC today.  Steroids kept me awake, and kicked my heart arrhythmia into overdrive, took an extra heart pill, I know I drive my cardiologist crazy. I'll give him my raitonale when I see him tomorrow lol Hope everyone has a good day
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Jun 17, 2009 07:58PM Tamara1201 wrote: Dbatt looks like we are on the same schedule , I started on June 11th also, and my next tx is July 2nd.. I've done pretty good, not felt like eating either, I think the Aloxi they gave me for nausea as a pre-med the day of chemo slowed everything down. That day I think everything I drank just stayed in my stomach, I'm so bright I didn't realize it until about 10 pm when I felt like I was going to throw up just because I was so full, it finally started moving about 3 am but it was a long night. I've been having burning in my fingers and toes for a couple of days, but hadn't really thought about it being a SE, even though I knew it would do that, I just tend to ignore things, guess I'll have to do better. I'm sorry about your partner, sounds like she has some issues she's not dealing with, and maybe just tries to distance herself instead of talking about them. It's that darn communication thing, if everyone would just communicate we would be so much better off. She picked a really bad time, and I hope you have some friends or family who can help support you. My boyfriend has been very good and supportive so far, but one never knows. I hope things go well for you
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Jun 8, 2009 05:05PM Tamara1201 wrote: Hi Everyone, Kat43 & Beach2Read, Looks like I'll be on the same schedule as the two of you, I'm starting chemo this week too, TC X4. They were supposed to start it last Thursday, but my liver enzymes were elevated, so they repeated them and ordered a CT. I had the CT of my abd on Friday, and went and got the report today, and it was all clear. That was a huge relief, I really haven't been worried a lot during this adventure so far, just feel like everything will be okay, some call it denial lol, but I have to admit I was really worried about the liver thing, so I will sleep better tonight. They don't plan to put a port in for my chemo, and my veins aren't the best in the world, so I hope they hold up. Happy Birthday Kat43,I know this isn't how you would want to celebrate, but I'm like you, I want to get things started Tamara
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Jul 11, 2009 03:38PM Tamara1201 wrote: Pdaw, I had the same problem as you, I wrote a really long post last week, then with my fuzzy brain tried to go back to the previous page to see who wrote something, and lost it all. I was so frustrated with myself, haven't written anything since, well until now I had 2nd treatment on July 2, hasn't been too bad, little nausea but I'm so exhausted I can hardly think. I get pretty severe fatigue from the Multiple Sclerosis, but this on top of it has made me worthless. I do still manage to make it to the store for essentials, and walk the dog every night for 15 or 20 minutes, but not at a very fast pace. I had my hair cut really short 2 weeks ago, was going to shave it but my daughters friend who is a hair dresser didnt' want to do that, so she just cut it short. I still have a fair amount of hair, but I had huge amounts, it was really fine. I have a bald spot, but I'm so tall not many people see it, guess that's a benefit of being tall lol. My scalp has been kind of sore today, so not sure if more is about to tall out or what. Zuzee, I'm sure your man friend will be okay with the bald head, my man friend told me he thought bald was sexy, now he could have been trying to make me feel better, because he loved my hair, but he really doesn't  act like he loss of hair I have had so far bothers him, guess we will see when it's all gone PAP, I too have had no appetite, which is unusual for me, I forget that I need to eat. I'm sure I get enough in overall, but really have to force myself sometimes. My taste is off, and when I do eat I feel like it just sits in my stomach forever so dont' want to eat for the rest of the day. I need to lose weight, but even this doesnt' seem to be doing it, still retaining fluids from the steroids. Laura, I live in Florida, and it's way too hot here to wear a wig. I forget sometimes that my hair is just about all gone, until I look in a mirror. I get some strange looks too, but most of the people I see are tourist so I'll never see them again anyway. It does feel really strange in the shower though, used to take me forever to rinse my hair, so I'm saving lots of time, and $$$ lol Becky, that is a wierd feeling in the shower, having no hair to pull back and squeeze water out of. I also keep thinking I feel it behind me when I'm laying down, and need to pull it ouf of the way. It is much cooler in this heat, feeling the breeze blowing across my scalp is an odd feeling, I worry about taking supplements because I have to be careful with the Multiple Sclerosis, I cant' take anything that stimulates the immune system, because my immune system attacks my nervous system, so in theory it could make it worse. I really need to go see a Nutritionist, if I ever get enough energy. I hope everyone has a nice, SE free weekend  Tammy
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Jun 26, 2009 04:37PM Tamara1201 wrote: Happy Birthday Candy, I'm sorry about the frustration with the timing of your hair loss, not that there is really a good time, but I'm sure you will look beautiful for the graduation and birthday. Today is day 15 post TC for me, and my hair started falling out yesterday, just a little more than usual on my fingers when I ran my hand thru it yesterday, but today it's been a hand full of hair everytime I did. I went out on the balcony and kept running my fingers thru my hair and letting it fly away, trying to keep it from falling out in the house, like Candy I have enough animal hair to pick up, don't want to have to pick up mine too. My daughter is going to shave it tonight, or in the morning, but if you cut it really short, are all of those really short hairs irritating when they fall out? seems like they would get stuck in clothes and sheets. My scalp is so sore, I think if having it shaved will help, it will be a good thing, when I was outside the wind blew my hair and I had to hold it down because it hurt my scalp, I'm sure my neighbors really wonder about me now. lol I hope everyone has a nice, relaxing SE free weekend
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Jun 4, 2009 06:44PM Tamara1201 wrote: Hi Everyone, I am new to these boards, and the whole experience, but I have enjoyed, and been comforted by, reading these post. I thought I posted something earlier, but I guess I must have forgotten to hit a button, because I can't find it, if it's a duplicate I apoligize. I think I kind of lost some of this message again, when I messed up and tried to cut and past, so if it doens't make a lot of sense, blame it on the steroids, although in reality it's a daily experience in my life :-)   I was supposed to start chemo today, cytoxan and taxotere, took my steroids last night, slept maybe 3 hrs, took more this morning, then when I got there and was talking with my doctor found out my liver enzymes were elevated. I have to get them checked every three months for some other meds I take, and they were fine in February, so not sure what's up, of course when we were discussing the possible cause, he had to mention that liver cancer would do that, but I'm thinking positive that is is something else.. We decided to redraw them, and I have to get a CT of my abdomen, and try again next week. The good news is I can get the CT done tomorrow afternoon, so should be able to get the report Monday or Tuesday, so I won't have long to wait. I have been so tired all afternoon, but couldn't sleep thanks to the steroids, or even rest, so hopefully I will sleep tonight. Jo, I'm sorry you had such a bad reaction, I know that must have been scary. I read another post on here where, of course I don't have a clue which one, someone had the same reaction, I think she said they gave her more benadryl and slowed the infusion down, and she tolerated it okay then. I hope you do better tomorrow. I have looked at some wigs, and will probably get one for "special occassions"  my insurance will come part of it, if I go to a network provider. The closest one is about 40 miles away, so I'm not sure if I'm going to do that, or just get one locally and send it in and they should pay, just not as much. I live in Florida, and it's soooooooo hot and humid, I'm really not sure I would want to wear it very often. I have never been a hat or scarf person either, but I think I'm about to become one.  I  did decide that summer is a good time to not have hair in Florida, when I was drying my hair the other night, it takes so long, and I get so hot, my head sweats so much it's wet again before I finish drying it, I decided I really wouldn't miss that for a while, and I decided I would save all kinds of $$ on shampoo and conditioner and getting my hair done, oh and no need for mascara for a while. I have blonde eyelashes and eye brows, so not having them won't be a big difference, I too like most of you am trying to find some positive points in the whole experience I am going to a, I think it's " Look good feel better" that is sponsered by the ACS that is supposed to help you with ways to look like you have them, even when you don't, we shall see  Anyway, good luck to all of you, thanks for listening  Tamara
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Jun 20, 2009 04:50PM Tamara1201 wrote: Rinna40, I didn't get the emend, but they gave me Aloxi before the chemo, which is supposed to last for 3 days.It says the emend is to prevent nausea, not help it once you have it, so I guess it's kind of the same idea. I read on the Aloxi earlier and it has some residual effect until 6 or 7 days so I'm thinking it wore off. I'll ask my doctor about the emend though, it is on my insurance so thanks. It's funny, it's almost like morning sickness, worse in the am and gets better later, and I told someone the other day the only thing that tasted good at set well on my stomach was watermellon and potato chips and it sounded like I was pregnant. I'm way past that time of my life, maybe no so much in years but mentality lol djlanders, I think the emend must be over $30 a pill here, I think my insurance said it's retail price for the "3 fold" 1 pill a day for 3 days is a little over $100, but with my insurance it would be $45

I keep taking stool softeners so I don't get constipated, my diet is so messed up it's not always easy to regulate though, so don't want to go far from the bathroom most of the time
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Jun 20, 2009 09:37AM Tamara1201 wrote: Well,I'm on day 9, and have felt worse the last 2 days than anytime before. I've had headaches and pretty significant nausea, only threw up once thank God. I'm not sure if it's the chemo, or I'm getting a bug or something. I used to get migraines a lot,and the headaches are similar to that, but when they put me on a beta blocker for my heart, it kind of cured the migraines. Whatever it is, I hope it gets better, I have a difficult time drinking enough, well don't want to eat either, but that won't really hurt me, but I do need to get more fluids in.  When I took a shower last night, my scalp was sore, like it had been in a pony tail too long, and it startled me, I mean I should have hair for 6 more days,guess it's just getting geared up for the big event. I'm going to get it shaved as soon as it starts falling out, then walk around with a towel around my neck all the time to absorb the sweat I guess. It's so hot and humid here the sweat can't evaporate, think I should have moved north when I had the chance lol hope everyone has a relaxing, SE free, weekend
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Jun 20, 2009 05:40PM Tamara1201 wrote: TomnDi, I had the face flushing stuff, only lasted a couple of days fortunately. I'm one to flush pretty easily anyway, very pale, but it does feel like your face is on fire at the time. They told me the taxotere could do that, but I thought they meant during the treatment so it was a surprise. I wish I had your weather, ours is hotter than normal, heat index this afternoon was 115, needless to say I don't go outside much.  I hope you all have a nice weekend
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Jun 27, 2009 07:03PM Tamara1201 wrote: Carolyn, it's way too hot here to stay out very long, but fortunately when I go out front, I get a little breeze from the Gulf, I'm about a mile inland but still get some air. One of my downstairs neighbors didn't like when the dust went on his balcony, not sure how he will feel about the hair lol. I have been having headaches a lot, but I'm not sure why. I have a history of migraines but they had been under control with the medicine for my heart. I feel like the way my scalp hurts it could be contributing to them. Greymom_17, I've been walking around with one of those rolling sticky lint removers trying to catch hair, well that and my plastic grocery bag that I put my hair in when I run my fingers thru it and pull out handfulls lol We are going to shave it tomorrow, does that help make your scalp any less sore? Bonnid, sorry about the fever, hope the cipro takes care of it. I have my second TC treatment this coming Thursday, so I guess you are a week ahead of me. I have trouble keeping up with who has written when I write too, confuse myself and end up not making any sense, not that I ever made a lot of sense Zuzeee, I actually really like the short hair cut I got for my hair to fall out, and I probably would never have gotten it if it weren't for the fact that it would be falling out. It's been much easier to take care of that I had expected, so who knows, when it grows back, it might not have to grow quiet as far as it started
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Oct 31, 2009 08:23AM Tamara1201 wrote: Hi Everyone, I haven't posted in a very long time, I've been reading, just not writing, not sure why. I finished chemo the middle of August, had some peach fuzz on my head, then it started falling out again the first week in Sept so I shaved it again, had all these different lengths and textures of hair, so I just got rid of it. Now I have about 1/2 inch of hair, maybe a little more, but it's growing in all kinds of colors, light in the front, maybe blonde/gray, but the back is really dark, my daughter says I'm going to have black hair!  If so it's not fair that my eyebrows and eyelashes are growing back blonde, like they were. I guess time will tell, and whatever it is, it will be hair and I can get the color fixed if I need to lol.  I started Rads the middle of Sept, 25 regular and 8 boost, I have my last boost Monday. My skin has done really well, just a little sun burned looking, which is surprising because I am so pale it was kind of expected that I would do worse.I have been very tired, but I have Multiple Sclerosis, which makes me tired to begin with, but this just makes it worse.The most frustrating part is I will be exhausted in the afternoon, and try to take a nap, but just can't go to sleep. gjlanders, hope you have fun in Dublin, sounds very exciting!  Did they put tattoos on you to line up the machine or just the marks? I have 3 very small tattoos, to help line up the machine, and then they put an X on my chest, with a sharpie, to make it easier, and put tape over that. I was surpsied how long it would stay on there.  Just make sure you don't put any thing on your skin before you go for your treatments, they told me that is what causes the most problems. It's such a habit, I nearly put deodorant under that arm several times and had to wash it off. I hope everyone has a great weekend, sorry for such a long post, I've been told I write like I talk lol
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Nov 23, 2009 01:40PM Tamara1201 wrote: You look great Chelev, I think I see some straightening in my future too. I need to get my daughter to take a picture, I'm just looking forward to the day I have bangs, and don't look like  a kid that got hold of the scissors lol
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Jan 20, 2010 01:31PM Tamara1201 wrote: MaryNY, I think the F in PFC can be a swear word if you want it to be, if not then it can be final. It's a swear word I really don't use, or say out loud, and least not very often, but somehow seems appropriate for the chemo ordeal. I'm 5 months PFC, my hair started coming back, peach fuzz, toward the end of my chemo TC X 4, but it started falling out again and looked weird, so I shaved it again the first of Sept. I have maybe an inch of hair, it's hard to tell it's so curly. I have had all of my life board straight blonde hair and it came back in curly, dark and gray. The gray isn't really surprising, but the dark, almost black part is. My eyelashes and eye brows fell out after I finiished chemo, and I'm really not sure exactly when they came back but didn't seem to take too long. I have always had blonde brows and lashes, and they came back that way, so didn't notice at first, I told my doctor it's just not fair that my hair comes in dark and my lashes don't. I would put a picture in here, but not sure how to do that, might have to break down and read directions lol. I made an appt to get my hair colored, but decided to wait a bit and see what it does. Everyone tells it me looks good, but I feel like I'm looking at a stranger when I look in the mirror. Has anyone heard of your hair turning back to it's normal color after a while? Dr Oz had something on last week about why hair grays, and talked about the, well I'm not sure if it was a gland or what, but something in your scalp that that gives hair it's pigmet and how stress can damage it. Probably wishfull thinking on my part lol. I think I'm going to look for that Lancome eyebrow color too, I've never been very good at putting that stuff on, looks funny to me, but it's worth a shot
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Feb 16, 2010 02:27PM Tamara1201 wrote: Charmaine, congradulations on your last treatment!  I am 6 months PFC and just got my first hair "cut", although my own daughter couldn't tell I had anything done, but I could, gave it some shape and got rid of some frizz. I did actually shave my head again after the last treatment, I had a mohawk, or shark fin, look on top, about 1" blonde standing straight up, and "fuzz" on the side, looked more  like duck down than hair, and it was falling out again at the same time, so I just decided to shave it so it would all be growing at the same time, but mostly because of the hair falling out. ccbaby, your hair is beautiful, I'm looking forward to the bangs day myself, even though I've never been one for bangs, too many cowlicks lol.  I'm sure it is difficult being a hair dresser and dealing with so many people who are unhappy with their hair, when you didn't have any. It does grow, but seems slowly, and I had straight blonde hair before, and now it's curly and, well salt and pepper, never had hair this dark. Everyone tells me it looks good, but to me it's like looking at a stranger in the mirror. I want to do something to the color, but decided to wait until it grows a bit more.  My eyebrows and lashes came back blonde, although they have fallen out and growing back for the second time, have like 3 long lashes on my left eye and the rest are really short, everytime I try to put on mascara I wonder why I am doing that. I read on here a lot, but don't post usually because I have a hard time remembering who said what, but enjoy reading and am inspired by all the strong women on this site, and appreciate the helpful hints.

Posts.Content: Jun 7, 2009 03:20PM Tamara1201 wrote: Hi CristiC, I haven't started my chemo yet, was supposed to last week but was delayed because my liver enzymes were elevated, so trying again next week.  I always had very fine, VERY straight blonde hair, but something happened when I turned 40, it started getting curly. Not a pretty curly though, an aggravating curly, like kinky curls in the under layers and if I let my hair dry by it's self now, as opposed to blow drying it, it looks really crazy, with kinks, curls and waves. My hair has always been darker underneath, so I figure there is no telling what it will be like once I lose it, and it starts growing back, imagine there will be a fair amount of gray, but my hair dresser can always fix that, eventually. Tamara

Posts.Content: Nov 23, 2009 11:58AM Tamara1201 wrote: Lolly the back of your head looks just like mine lol, I'm 11 weeks PFC, and it seems like it grew this much and just slowed down, but mine is coming in curly, had always been straight. Redheadpam, I was on the taxotere and cytoxan too, and actually ended up shaving my head again a couple of times, the last about 2 weeks after my last treatment, had peach fuzz coming in on the sides, and a mohawk on top, maybe I should have left it, that was blonde and it's a lot darker and more gray now. My eyelashes and eyebrows came back blonde, like they have always been, said it's not fair my hair got darker and my lashes didn't. You know, I prepared myself for it falling out, but I don't think I got past that, I mean I knew it could come back differently, but didn't really think about it. Thank goodness my hair stylist is very good at fixing color, if only it would get long enough. I'm just happy to have hair Have a great day Everyone!

Posts.Content: May 4, 2010 06:23PM Tamara1201 wrote: Thank you JJuannelle for the tip about copying pics from facebook, it's been driving me crazy trying to add them from my photos on my computer.This pic was the end of March before my last trim, you have to enlarge it to see really see the curls, but someone earlier said poodle, and it seems appropriate. I'm almost 9 months pfc, but shaved my head again the 1st of Sept. I've had my hair trimmed twice, more to shape, but I think if I stretch the hair on the top of my head out, it's 5" long.  I love those short haircuts, has anyone seen something for short, VERY curly hair, now it just does what it wants to? I've always had very straight hair, so I'm just at a loss as to what to do with this. I'm keeping the sides and back trimmed until the top grows out some, this is what my hair dresser said to do, if not I get real wings on the sides, still do some. I'm trying to wait until it grows some to color it because I'd rather get it highlighted instead of whole head coloring, but I'm not sure if I'm going to make it. I have found that really curly hair needs lots of conditioner, like condition in in the shower, and then add leave in condtioner, but still wild at times. I'm thankful to have hair, but still feel like I'm looking at a stanger in the mirror sometimes. I hope everyone is doing well, and hair grows swiftly
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Oct 18, 2009 02:45PM Tamara1201 wrote: Hi Everyone, I just came across this topic and it's nice to find it. I had my last chem taxotere and cytoxin, 9 weeks ago. I started getting some peach fuzz, or more like duck whatever it's called lol, about 2 weeks out, then at 3 it started falling out again so I shaved it, again. Now I have maybe 3/4 of an inch, and I say it looks like a calico cat, all kinds of colors. I had shoulder length blonde hair, well with some gray, and I'm not sure what it will be now, but it's hair and I can work with it whatever it is. I've not really worn a wig, too hot here in Florida and my head sweats anyway. I thought I might use one some now that it's cooler if I have somewhere special to go. My question is, the eyebrows and eyelashes, how long do they take to come back? I have always had blonde eyelashes and eyebrows, so it's not a big loss, but I started to put some mascara on last week and realized I only an occasionaly lash left, looked funny to say the least. I was thinking I might buy some of that lash stuff, to help them grow, I looked on drugstore.com and the rapid lash renewal serum had good reviews. Have any of you heard anything about any of these products? I've read about the latisse, but I have blue eyes and I'd hate for it turn my blue eyes brown. Isn't that the opposite of some song? lol  Sorry my post is so long, I've been told I write like I talk, and I'm not sure it was a compliment :-)
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53
